Who determined the exact speed of light?
Albert Einstein
No. Albert Michelson determined the exact speed of light.[KH3]
No. Thomas Edison did not determine the exact speed of light.
No. Marconi won a Nobel prize for his work with radio waves.
How is the Michelson-Morely experiment related to Albert Einstein’s theory of relativity?

In 1887, Albert Michelson and Edward Morely carried out experiments to detect the change in speed of light due to ether wind when the Earth moved around the sun. The result was negative. They found the speed of light is always the …
